00071 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00072 
00073 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00074 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00075 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00076 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00077 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00078 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00079 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00080 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00081 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)

00083 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00084 
00085 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00086 
00087 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00088 
00089 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00090 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00092 
00093 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00094 
00095     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00096 }
00097 
00098 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00099 
00100 {
00101     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00102     spl_t flags;
00103 
00104     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00105 
00106     adeos_load_cpuid();
00107 
00108     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00109         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00110             {
00111             if (!flags)
00112                 {
00113                 clear_bit(cpuid, lock);
00114                 rthal_sync_irqs();
00115                 adeos_load_cpuid(); /* Could have been migrated by interrupts. */
00116                 set_bit(cpuid, lock);
00117                 }
00118             else
00119                 rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00120             }
00121     else
00122         flags |= 2;
00123 
00124     return flags;
00125 }
00126 
00127 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00128 
00129 {
00130     if (!(flags & 2))
00131         {
00132         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00133 
00134         rthal_cli();
00135 
00136         adeos_load_cpuid();
00137 
00138         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00139             {
00140             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00141             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00142             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00143             }
00144         }
00145 
00146     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00147 }
00148 
00149 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00150 
00151 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00152 
00153 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00154 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00155 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00156 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00157 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00158 
00159 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00163 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00164 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00165 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00166 /* Using 2/3 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00167    experimentation that proved to fit on tested PPC platforms with
00168    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00169    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00170    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00171 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 2 / 3)

00211 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00212 
00213     /* Kernel mode side */
00214 
00215 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00216     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00217        and SPE are not available to kernel-based Xenomai threads. */
00218     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00219     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00220 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00221 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00222 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00223 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00224 
00225     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00226     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00227     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00228     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00229 
00230     /* User mode side */
00231     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00232     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00233 
00234     /* Init block */
00235     struct xnthread *self;
00236     int imask;
00237     const char *name;
00238     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00239     void *cookie;
00240 
00241 } xnarchtcb_t;

00257 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00258     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00259 }
00260 
00261 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00262     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00263 }
00264 
00265 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00266     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00267 }
00268 
00269 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00270     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00271 }

00274     return adeos_processor_id();

00281 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00282 do { \
00283     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00284     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00285     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00286     for (;;) ;                          \
00287 } while(0)

00292 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00293 
00294 {
00295     spl_t s;
00296     splhigh(s);
00297     splexit(!!imask);
00298     return !!s;
00299 }

00303 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00304                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00305                                                    void *cookie),
00306                                    void *cookie)
00307 {
00308     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00309 
00310     if (!err)
00311         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00312 
00313     return err;
00314 }
00315 
00316 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00317 
00318     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00319 }
00320 
00321 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00322 
00323 {
00324     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00325         return -EINVAL;
00326 
00327     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00328 
00329     return 0;
00330 }
00331 
00332 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00333 
00334 {
00335     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00336         return -EINVAL;
00337 
00338     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00339 
00340     return 0;
00341 }

00344     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);

00348     rthal_enable_irq(irq);

00352 
00353     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00369 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00370 
00371 {
00372 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00373     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00374 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00375     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00376        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00377     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00378 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00379 }

00381 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00382                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00383     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00384 }
00385 
00386 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00387 
00388 {
00389     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00390 
00391     adeos_load_cpuid();
00392 
00393     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00394        and always inside a critical section. */
00395     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00396     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00397     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00398     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00399 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00400     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00401 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00402 }
00403 
00404 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00405     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00406 }
00407 
00408 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00409                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00410 {
00411     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00412     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00413     unsigned long flags;
00414 
00415     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00416 
00417     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00418 
00419     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00420         {
00421         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00422         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00423 
00424         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00425 
00426         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00427 
00428         if (prev != next)
00429             {
00430             get_mmu_context(next);
00431             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00432             }
00433 
00434         if (!inproc->mm)
00435             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00436 
00437         /* The following has been lifted from
00438            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00439 
00440 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00441         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00442             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00443 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00444         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00445             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00446 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00447 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00448         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00449             giveup_spe(outproc);
00450 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00451 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00452 
00453 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00454         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00455             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00456 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00457 
00458 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00459         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00460             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00461 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00462 
00463         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00464         }
00465     else
00466         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00467         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00468 
00469     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00470 }
00471 
00472 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00473                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00474     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00475 }
00476 
00477 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00478     /* Empty */
00479 }
00480 
00481 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00482 
00483 {
00484 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00485 
00486     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00487 
00488     if (task)
00489         {
00490         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00491             giveup_fpu(task);
00492 
00493         return;
00494         }
00495 
00496     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00497 
00498     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00499 
00500 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00501 }
00502 
00503 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00504 
00505 {
00506 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00507 
00508     if (tcb->user_task)
00509         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00510            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00511            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00512         return;
00513 
00514     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00515 
00516     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00517 
00518 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00519 }
00520 
00521 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00522                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00523                                          const char *name)
00524 {
00525     tcb->user_task = current;
00526     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00527     tcb->ksp = 0;
00528     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00529 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00530     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00531 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00532     tcb->entry = NULL;
00533     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00534     tcb->self = thread;
00535     tcb->imask = 0;
00536     tcb->name = name;
00537 }
00538 
00539 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00540 
00541     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00542     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00543     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00544 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00545     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00546 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00547     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00548 }
00549 
00550 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00551 
00552 {
00553     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00554     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00555     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00556     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00557 }
00558 
00559 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00560                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00561                                        void *cookie,
00562                                        int imask,
00563                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00564                                        char *name)
00565 {
00566     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00567 
00568     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00569 
00570     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00571     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00572     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00573     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00574     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00575     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00576 
00577     tcb->entry = entry;
00578     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00579     tcb->self = thread;
00580     tcb->imask = imask;
00581     tcb->name = name;
00582 }
00583 
00584 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00585 
00586 {
00587 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00588     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00589        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00590     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00591     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00592 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00593 }
00594 
00595 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00596 
00597     while (!*flagp)
00598         {
00599         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00600         schedule_timeout(1);
00601         }
00602 }
00603 
00604 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00605 
00606 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00607 
00608     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00609 }
00610 
00611 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00612 
00613 {
00614     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00615                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00616                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00617                                      NULL,
00618                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00619 }
00620 
00621 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00622 
00623 {
00624     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00625                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00626                                      NULL,
00627                                      NULL,
00628                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00629 }
00630 
00631 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00632 
00633 {
00634     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00635     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00636 }
00637 
00638 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00639 
00640 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00641 
00642     return 0;
00643 }
00644 
00645 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00646 
00647     return 0;
00648 }
00649 
00650 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00651 
00652     return 0;
00653 }
00654 
00655 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00656 
00657 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00658 
00659 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00660 
00661 {
00662 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00663     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00664        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00665     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00666 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00667     xnshadow_release_events();
00668     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00669     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00670     schedule_timeout(50);
00671     xnarch_release_ipi();
00672 }
00673 
00674 static inline void xnarch_escalate (void) {
00675 
00676     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00677     adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00678 }
00679 
00680 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00681 
00682     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00683 }
00684 
00685 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00686 
00687     kfree(chunk);
00688 }
00689 
00690 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00691     
00692     xnshadow_grab_events();
00693 }
00694 
00695 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00696 
00697 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00698 
00699 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00700                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00701                                            const char *name)
00702 {
00703     struct task_struct *task = current;
00704 
00705     tcb->user_task = task;
00706     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00707     tcb->ksp = 0;
00708     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00709 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00710     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00711 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00712     tcb->entry = NULL;
00713     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00714     tcb->self = thread;
00715     tcb->imask = 0;
00716     tcb->name = name;
00717 }
00718 
00719 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00720 
00721 {
00722     unsigned irq;
00723 
00724     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00725         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00726                              handler,
00727                              NULL,
00728                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00729 
00730     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00731        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00732        individually. */
00733 
00734     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00735                          handler,
00736                          NULL,
00737                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00738 }
00739 
00740 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00741 
00742 {
00743     unsigned irq;
00744 
00745     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00746         {
00747         switch (irq)
00748             {
00749 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00750             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00751 
00752                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00753                 continue;
00754 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00755 
00756             default:
00757 
00758                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00759             }
00760         }
00761 
00762     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00763 }
00764 
00765 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00766 
00767 {
00768     unsigned irq;
00769 
00770     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00771         {
00772         switch (irq)
00773             {
00774 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00775             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00776 
00777                 continue;
00778 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00779 
00780             default:
00781 
00782                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00783             }
00784         }
00785 
00786     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00787 }
00788 
00789 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00790 
00791 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00792 
00793 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00794     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00795        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00796        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. Since the
00797        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00798        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */ 
00799     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00800 }
00801 
00802 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00803     rthal_release_timer();
00804 }
00805 
00806 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00807 
00808 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00809 
00810 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00811 
00812 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00813 
00814 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00815 
00816 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00817 
00818 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00819 
00820 {
00821     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00822     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00823     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00824 }
00825 
00826 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00827 
00828 {
00829 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00830     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00831        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00832     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00833 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00834 
00835     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00836 
00837     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00838         return -ENOSYS;
00839 
00840     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00841                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00842                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00843                               NULL,
00844                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00845 
00846     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00847 
00848     return xnshadow_init();
00849 }
00850 
00851 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00852 
00853     xnshadow_cleanup();
00854     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00855     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00856 }
00857 
00858 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00859 
00860 #ifdef __cplusplus
00861 }
00862 #endif

00869 #define xnarch_post_graph(obj,state)
00870 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
